p: Previously, some of us have built the Indian Medicinal Plants, Phytochemistry And Therapeutics (IMPPAT) database [ 28] which is the largest resource on phytochemicals of Indian herbs to date. For this study, we compiled a ligand library of 14,011 phytochemicals by augmenting the information in IMPPAT [ 28] with additional information compiled from other literature sources [ 61, 62, 63, 64, 65, 66, 67, 68, 69, 70]. Thereafter, the widely used drug-likeness measure, Lipinskiâ€™s rule of five (RO5) [ 29], was employed to filter the potential drug-like molecules within the ligand library of 14,011 phytochemicals. Specifically, 10,510 phytochemicals passed the R05 drug-likeness filter. We then retrieved the three-dimensional (3D) structures of these phytochemicals from Pubchem [ 30]. Next the 3D structures of the drug-like phytochemicals were energy-minimized using obminimize within the OpenBabel toolbox [ 31]. Finally, the energy-minimized 3D structures of ligands in .sdf format were converted to .pdb format using OpenBabel.
